edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.parameters
Class ParameterDictionary

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.parameters.ParameterDictionary
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ParameterDictionary
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Represents a set of key, value string pairs that specify various parameters for the analysis and their values.

This is essentially just a hashtable, but contains convenience methods for getting values as different types, as well as for parsing parameters from command line options.

Author:
Colin J. Fuller
See Also:

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ParameterDictionary

public ParameterDictionary(ParameterDictionary toCopy)
Copy constructor. This will create a new ParameterDictionary using the key, value pairs in another ParameterDictionary. This only makes a semi-shallow copy. The internal storage of the two ParameterDictionaries is distinct, so adding a key, value pair to one will not affect the other. However, the key and value objects originally present will likely not be copied. Currently, the implementation exclusively uses Strings as the internal keys and values, and these are immutable, so this should not cause a problem.

Parameters:
toCopy - The ParameterDictionary whose keys/values are to be copied.
Method Detail

emptyDictionary

public static ParameterDictionary emptyDictionary()
Factory method to create a new empty dictionary.

Returns:
A new ParameterDictionary whose internal storage has been initialized but contains no entries.

parseArgumentListToParameterDictionary

public static ParameterDictionary parseArgumentListToParameterDictionary(java.lang.String[] args)
Parses a String array containing command line arguments and creates a new ParameterDictionary containing these entries. Each entry in the String array should be a single key-value pair in the format "key=value". Allowable characters in the keys and values are alphanumeric characters, underscores, hyphens, periods, forward and backslashes, and colons.

Parameters:
args - The String array containing arguments (can be the string array argument to main(String[])).
Returns:
A new ParameterDictionary containing the parsed arguments.

parseParametersFileToParameterDictionary

public static ParameterDictionary parseParametersFileToParameterDictionary(java.lang.String filename)
                                                                    throws java.io.IOException
Deprecated. Use {#link readParametersFromFile} instead with XML-format parameters.

Parses a file containing parameter key-value pairs and creates a new ParameterDictionary containing these entries.

The parameters file should contain one key-value pair per line in the format "key=value". Allowable characters in the keys and values are alphanumeric characters, underscores, hyphens, periods, forward and backslashes, and colons.

Empty lines and lines starting with # will be ignored.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file containing the parameters.
Returns:
A new ParameterDictionary containing the parsed arguments.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an exception is encountered while reading the file.

getValueForKey

public java.lang.String getValueForKey(java.lang.String key)
Gets the value stored for a given key. Returns null, as per the specification in java.util.Hashtable if there is no value for key stored.

Parameters:
key - The key whose associated value is to be returned.
Returns:
The corresponding value, in String format.

getIntValueForKey

public int getIntValueForKey(java.lang.String key)
Gets the value stored for a given key as an int. Does not perform type-checking on the conversion from String to int.

Parameters:
key - The key whose associated value is to be returned.
Returns:
The corresponding value, as an int.

getBooleanValueForKey

public boolean getBooleanValueForKey(java.lang.String key)
Gets the value stored for a given key as a boolean. Does not perform type-checking on the conversion from String to boolean.

Parameters:
key - The key whose associated value is to be returned.
Returns:
The corresponding value, as a boolean.

getDoubleValueForKey

public double getDoubleValueForKey(java.lang.String key)
Gets the value stored for a given key as a double. Does not perform type-checking on the conversion from String to double.

Parameters:
key - The key whose associated value is to be returned.
Returns:
The corresponding value, as a double.

hasKeyAndTrue

public boolean hasKeyAndTrue(java.lang.String key)
Convenience method for checking if the ParameterDictionary has a key and that the corresponding value is true.

Parameters:
key - The key to be checked.
Returns:
The logical and of hasKey(key) and getBooleanValueForKey(key).

addIfNotSet

public void addIfNotSet(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String value)
Adds a key, value pair to the ParameterDictionary. Does nothing if the specified key already has an associated value. This method is useful for setting up default values after parsing user-specified options, as the defaults will not overwrite the existing values.

Parameters:
key - The key to add to the ParameterDictionary if it is not present.
value - The key's associated value.

discardIllegalArguments

public void discardIllegalArguments(java.lang.String[] legalArguments)
Removes all key,value pairs from the ParameterDictionary that are not listed in a specified array of valid keys.

Parameters:
legalArguments - A String array containing the valid keys; any key, value pair not matching one of these keys will be discarded.

hasKey

public boolean hasKey(java.lang.String key)
Checks if the ParameterDictionary contains a specified key.

Parameters:
key - A String that is the key to check for in this ParameterDictionary.
Returns:
A boolean corresponding to whether the specified key has an associated value.

setValueForKey

public void setValueForKey(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.String value)
Adds a key, value pair to the ParameterDictionary. This is distinct from addIfNotSet(String, String) in that this method will overwrite any existing value.

Parameters:
key - The key to add to the ParameterDictionary.
value - The value associated with the key, which will overwrite any existing value.

writeParametersToFile

public void writeParametersToFile(java.lang.String filename)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the ParameterDictionary's contents to a specified file in plaintext format.

Parameters:
filename - The full filename (including path); any existing file with this name will be overwritten without confirmation.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an IOException occurs while opening or writing to the file.

readParametersFromFile

public static ParameterDictionary readParametersFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
Reads a set of parameters from an XML file.

Parameters:
filename - The XML file containing the parameter information.
Returns:
A ParameterDictionary containing the parameters parsed from the specified file.

addParameter

public void addParameter(Parameter p)
Adds a Parameter object to the parameter dictionary.

Parameters:
p - The Parameter to add.

getKeys

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeys()
Gets a set containing the names of all the parameters in the ParameterDictionary.

Returns:
The Set containing the names.

getTypeForKey

public int getTypeForKey(java.lang.String key)
Gets the Parameter type for a given parameter name as one of the values of the static fields in the Parameter class.

Parameters:
key - The name of the parameter.
Returns:
An integer corresponding to the type of the parameter. In the current implementation, which only uses strings, this will always be Parameter.TYPE_STRING, but may change in the future.
